data.title: The Best Movies With God in the Title
data.meta_description: Over 100 filmgoers have voted on the 60+ films on Best Movies With God in the Title. Current Top 3: City of God, Children of a Lesser God, Letters to God ...
data.text:
Ranked By

485 votes

178 voters

Voting Rules

Vote up your favorite movie with God in the name.

Have you ever noticed how many movies there are with God in the name? This list ranks the best movies with God in the title, regardless of genre or rating. What is your favorite movie with God in the name? This is kind of an odd way to categorize movies, but that's also why it's so fun! There are probably one or two movies with god in the title that you instantly think of, but you might be surprised how many others there are too as you scroll through this list.

This ranked poll of films with god in the title includes movies like City of God, Aguirre, the Wrath of God, and Only God Forgives. Don't forget that this list is interactive, meaning you can vote the film names up or down depending on much you liked each movie that has the word God in it.

Most divisive: Oh! My God 2

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best Movies With God in the Title

Alice Braga, Seu Jorge, Matheus Nachtergaele

City of God, a gritty and visceral masterpiece, leaves an indelible mark on the viewer's mind as they dive into the dangerous world of favelas in Rio de Janeiro. Peixe and Rocket, played by Alexandre Rodrigues and Leandro Firmino, captivate the audience as their lives weave a powerful and tragic tale of survival, hope, and unforgettable cinematography.

Released : 2002

Directed by : Fernando Meirelles

Dig Deeper The Best 'City Of God' Quotes

Also ranks # 233 on The Best Movies Roger Ebert Gave Four Stars

Also ranks # 17 on 22 Disturbing, Brutal Movies Based on Real-Life Atrocities

Children of a Lesser God explores the profound connection between a teacher and his deaf student, breaking society's barriers down brick by brick. With phenomenal performances by William Hurt and Marlee Matlin, the film tugs at the heartstrings while simultaneously challenging our perspectives on communication and love.

Released : 1986

Directed by : Randa Haines

Also ranks # 253 on The 470+ Best Chick Flicks Ever

Also ranks # 51 on The Best Movies of 1986

Also ranks # 35 on The Best Oscar-Nominated Movies of the '80s

Robyn Lively, Jeffrey Johnson, Tanner Maguire

Letters to God, a heart-wrenching yet uplifting film, tells the story of a young boy battling cancer who begins sending letters to God. The awe-inspiring journey of finding faith and hope against impossible odds is brought to life by Tanner Maguire's unforgettable performance.

Released : 2010

Directed by : David Nixon, Patrick Doughtie

Also ranks # 8 on The Best PG-Rated Inspirational Dramas

Also ranks # 76 on The 70+ Best PG Family Movies

Also ranks # 17 on The Best Christian Teen Movies, Ranked

Rebecca De Mornay, Vincent Spano, Frank Langella

And God Created Woman is an enticing romantic drama that navigates the thin line between love and desire. Brigitte Bardot's memorable portrayal of the free-spirited Juliette breathes fire into the film, setting screens alight with her beguiling charm and intense magnetism.

Released : 1988

Directed by : Roger Vadim

Jackie Chan, Carina Lau, Alan Tam

Armour of God, starring the inimitable Jackie Chan, is a pulse-pounding action-packed adventure that refuses to let up. Chan's portrayal of Asian Hawk, an adventurer seeking the titular armor, provides an electrifying performance complete with stunning stunts and jaw-dropping action sequences.

Released : 1986

Directed by : Eric Tsang, Jackie Chan

Ryan Gosling, Kristin Scott Thomas, Vithaya Pansringarm

Only God Forgives is a visual treat that transports viewers into a vivid and haunting underworld. Ryan Gosling's portrayal of a man on a path of vengeance and redemption is electrifying, and the hypnotic atmosphere created by Nicolas Winding Refn holds audiences captive.

Released : 2013

Directed by : Nicolas Winding Refn
